title: All eyes on Biden as the Title 42 impact hits far beyond southern border
description: The migrant crisis fueled by the end of Title 42 isn't just hitting border towns — it extends more than 1,000 miles from the nation’s southern border.

title: Artificial intelligence helping recycling center sort waste
description: At a recycling center in Boulder, Colorado, automation and artificial intelligence are becoming part of the process. The AI learned how to tell pieces of plastic from sheets of paper and also learns how to grab them. NBC News’ Jacob Ward has more details on the technology.

title: Trump notifies court of plans to appeal $5 million E. Jean Carroll verdict
description: Trump officially signaled plans to appeal the $5 million jury verdict this week that found him liable for sexually abusing and defaming writer E. Jean Carroll.

title: Elon Musk says he's hired a new CEO for Twitter and will reduce his own role
description: Twitter owner Elon Musk said Thursday he has hired a new CEO to run the social media platform.

title: House passes Republican border security bill hours before Covid restrictions lift
description: The House passed a GOP-backed bill to address immigration at the U.S.-Mexico border on Thursday, the same day Covid restrictions at the border are set to be lifted.

title: Charges expected for NYC subway rider who put Jordan Neely in fatal chokehold, sources say
description: Charges are expected tomorrow against Daniel Penny, the man who was caught on video putting Jordan Neely in a fatal chokehold on a New York City subway.

title: Natalee Holloway case timeline: Joran van der Sloot expected to be extradited
description: Joran van der Sloot, a Dutch man once investigated in the case of missing Alabama teenager Natalee Holloway, is expected to be extradited to the United States in connection with a fraud case.

title: Trump's comments on Mar-a-Lago documents 'like red meat to a prosecutor'
description: Former President Donald Trump’s comments Wednesday night about his handling of classified documents appeared to provide potentially important evidence for federal prosecutors investigating whether to charge him with a crime, legal experts say.

title: Feinstein returns to the Senate Judiciary Committee, helping advance Biden judges
description: Sen. Dianne Feinstein returned to the Senate Judiciary Committee on Thursday, allowing Democrats to advance more of President Joe Biden's judicial nominees.

title: At least 2 cases of drug-resistant ringworm infections found in the U.S., CDC says
description: Two cases of highly contagious, drug-resistant ringworm infections have been detected in New York City, the first such cases ever reported in the United States, the CDC said.

title: White House calls for ‘thorough investigation’ into Jordan Neely’s death
description: The White House is calling for a "thorough investigation" into the May 1 death of a Black man who died after a New York City subway rider put him in a chokehold.

title: Supreme Court throws out convictions in sweeping New York corruption probe
description: The Supreme Court narrowed an anticorruption law by ruling for an ex-aide to former New York Gov. Cuomo convicted of taking a bribe from a real estate developer.

title: Supreme Court rejects challenge to California pork industry restriction
description: The Supreme Court rejected a challenge to a California animal welfare law that would ban the sale of pork derived from breeding pigs housed in confined spaces.

title: Live updates: Bus of migrants arrives at VP Harris' residence
description: Title 42 immigration policy expires tonight, border officials prepare

title: How Europe is leading the world in building guardrails around AI
description: Authorities around the world are racing to draw up rules for artificial intelligence, including in the European Union, where draft legislation faced a pivotal moment on Thursday.

title: NBC News' Morgan Chesky opens up about 'frightening' health scare during hike
description: After hiking all of his life, NBC News correspondent Morgan Chesky had never heard of high-altitude pulmonary edema — until an incident he described as “absolutely frightening” could have led to a cardiac arrest.

title: Ukraine drives back Russian forces around Bakhmut in its first significant gains in months
description: Ukraine has forced Russia's military back from some positions around Bakhmut, according to commanders on both sides, while President Zelenskyy said Kyiv needed more time for its counteroffensive.

title: Dwindling immigration puts squeeze on home building
description: With roughly 30% of the construction jobs held by foreign-born people, the home building sector is struggling to find employees as the U.S. cracks down on immigration.

title: Parents in college admissions scandal have fraud convictions overturned, appeals court rules
description: The 1st U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals tossed all convictions against Gamal Abdelaziz and all but one conviction of another parent, John Wilson.

title: Jacklyn Zeman, longtime 'General Hospital' actor, dies at 70
description: Jacklyn Zeman, the screen actor who portrayed Barbara “Bobbie” Spencer across more than 800 episodes of “General Hospital,” has died.

title: Pure Trump re-injected into the main vein of American politics at CNN town hall
description: Americans saw a pure version of Donald Trump Wednesday — fortunately or unfortunately.

title: Trump dismisses his sex abuse verdict and gloats that it will help his 2024 bid
description: Former President Donald Trump mocked E. Jean Carroll as a "whack job" and insisted her account of being sexually assaulted by him decades ago was "fake."
